findings.description: android:allowBackup is set to false which is correct for a crypto wallet (prevents ADB backup of app data including encrypted keys). Good security practice.
cleartextTrafficPermitted=false is correctly set at base-config level. This enforces HTTPS for all HTTP clients (OkHttp, web3j, Retrofit) as specified in Decision 9.

google-services.json is in .gitignore which prevents Firebase config from being committed. However, the dummy google-services.json is created in CI workflow, which is acceptable for placeholder builds.
findings.recommendation: No action needed. google-services.json properly excluded.

findings.description: Security-sensitive patterns properly covered: .env, *.key, *.pem, credentials.json, secrets/, *.jks, *.keystore, signing.properties, local.properties. No gaps identified.

ProGuard rules keep BouncyCastle, bitcoinj, and web3j classes. This is necessary for crypto operations but means these libraries are fully visible in decompiled APK. Acceptable for MVP per Decision 10.
findings.recommendation: No action needed for MVP. Post-MVP: consider more targeted keep rules.

summary: Security posture is appropriate for project scaffold. network_security_config.xml correctly enforces HTTPS. allowBackup=false prevents ADB data extraction. .gitignore covers all security-sensitive patterns. No security blockers.
